Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action plan is
required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must
include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:

CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
• (b) A true copy of verification of education
from an accredited college or university
where minimum education requirements
are specified by rule.
One of seven employees’ files reviewed did not have a copy of verification of
education.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
• (1)An institution shall maintain employee records

prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:

obtained prior to employment from
persons unrelated to the employee and

• Consultation was not requested or provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the CAP is as follows:
The CAP was in response to special investigation 2023C0000625, with a CAP
approval dated 10/11/2023, the facility was found in non-compliance for Rule
400.4109 (c) Program Statement, Rule 400.4111 Job Discription, Rule 4127 Staff
to Resident Ratio, and Rule 4131 Complaince in Child Protection Law. The facility
has been in compliance with meeting the expectations of the set deadlines of
action steps within their corrective action plan. Staff involved was terminated, the
facility revised their policy, and all staff have been retrained.
The CAP for 2023 interim was approved on 10/25/2023, the facility was found in
non-complaince for Rule 4128(3) and Rule 4113 (1)(j). The facility’s corrective
action plan for their 2023 interim report has been fully implemented.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the facility’s budget
and the agency financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was done on time and was comprehensive
and reviewed all areas of noncompliance from the previous licensing review. The
facility’s corrective action plan for their 2023 interim report has been fully
implemented. No citations from the interim inspection in 2023 were cited as repeat
citations in this renewal inspection. The Chief Administrator stated all the action

steps previously committed to for any previous rule violations are continuously
being utilized by current staff as well as new hires.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling very supported by management, having the
necessary training and tools to provide care and supervision for the youths in the
program and expressed no concerns regarding the agency.
The agency does not currently have any youths in the program.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility is a short-term shelter type residential building. The shelter is on the
second floor. It has a living room, dining room, kitchen, 2 bathrooms, and 10
bedrooms with a bed in each bedroom. The facility is clean, neat, and appropriate.
There were no issues of concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
